problem.p: Two identical balls with different initial speeds slide down two frictionless tracks of the same height but different angles, and then reach the bottom. Which of the following quantities is (are) equal for these two processes?

choice.name: foil1
choice.text: The change in the balls' potential energies

choice.name: foil2
choice.text: The change in the balls' kinetic energies

choice.name: foil13
choice.text: The change in the balls' speeds

choice.name: foil1\4
choice.text: The change in the balls' kinetic energies & the change in the balls' speeds

choice.name: foil5
choice.text: The change in the balls' kinetic energies & the change in their potential energies

choice.name: foil6
choice.text: The change in the balls' speeds & the change in their potential energies
